title: New Sej nerfs seem a bit... much.
body:
She totally needs nerfs, since she's almost permabanned.

But
Flail of the Northern Winds (W) AoE damage max HP scaling down to 4/5/6/7/8% from 4/6/8/10/12%
Flail of the Northern Winds (W) Max HP on hit lowered to 4/4.5/5/5.5/6% from 4/5.5/7/8.5/10%
Seems pretty harsh.

The initial hit loses almost half it's damage and the DoT loses a third of it's scaling, those are pretty damn big nerfs to a move, I think the last time we saw a move hit that hard was when Warwicks W went down from 10 to 6 seconds in duration, and that went real bad for him. Seems like half the two nerfs would be more reasonable (10% HP scaling at max rank, and 8% max HP on hit)

I doubt the change would actually wreck Sej since she has more going for her in her kit than WW, but that's still a pretty big hit to a single move.

That is a relatively massive nerf. I love playing Sejuani, but I do feel she's a bit too strong.

That said, the nerf to her on-hit % max HP is a huge issue. That ability is used to break down bruisers and other tanks, cutting it down by 50% is going to put her way behind other tanks with % max HP abilities. It'll affect her ganking and teamfighting, and I think that's the point. What I'm most worried about though is her clear speed after the nerf. It's already pretty abysmal and she takes some punishment in the process...

Frankly, I'd leave the on-hit %max HP alone and focus more on the magic damage that scales with HP, that's a really uncommon mechanic that (while perfect for a tank) isn't very prevalent on any other champion and should be outmoded.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Zac

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Sejuani

It's arguably still better than Zac's post-nerf. Which other tanks do consistent max health damage while offering similar mobility CC and tankiness?

Sej hasn't really ever had a clear problem since they reworked her. She still will clear just as fast on her first clear and have less damage without items after which honestly isn't really that big of an issue.
She takes a lot of damage on her first clear.
Just like about any other jungler?
Most junglers can do a full clear.  Sej can't.  She's plenty tanky, but her speed is pretty bad.  Her abilities don't deal a lot of damage to the creeps early, tbh
Oh, she can, if you know how.

She takes more damage than other junglers. Jarvan has the same issue. With a 21/9/0 build and starting Krugs it went a little smoother, but still had to back after finishing blue buff. Could have been that I just got a better leash too. Sej isn't made to early gank anyway, so it's not too big of a deal. 

Go into a custom game and do a clear with Diana if you want to see the difference. With no leash you'll easily be able to do a full clear on both sides. Elise can do a full clear and gank with full HP. Vi also puts monsters down faster than they can damage her and clear 1 side, both red and blue and possibly throw out a gank.

Route, leash and help on the gromp with no usage of potions and usage of smite > Wolves, usage of 1 potion > red buff, usage of one potion and healing up to full by smiting it > Bird thingies > ROck thingies and usage of smite > Blue buff.  Because of her cc and ability to damage high hp targets she can clear the jungle in this certain route, which i tested many times. This works on all other champs.

Also about diana, that is total bullshit and you know it, her whole kit is badly designed for jungle and the only thing that helps her a little in there is a shield. I would even dare to say that diana is weaker in jungle and clearing than sehuani. Elise can ideed have a full clear with full hp, but dont forget that for all of her strenghts she was nerfed into oblivion. And vi, is just plainly broken, and another example of "Build tank, assasinate everyone" type of a champion.

I didn't say Diana was a great jungle (I'm not giving an opinion on that), but you can go into a custom game and do a full clear with no leash. It's not bullshit anyone who can right click can do it. 

As for your jungle route, it's ideal for saving hp but there is a lot of wasted movement. You start gromp, wolves, go all the way to red buff, raptors, rocks, and then go all the way back to blue buff. Unless you're scared of an invade, or one or two of your lanes are getting pushed real hard early game it just seems more efficient to back after clearing half the jungle. But if it works for you, I can't argue with results.

Well, my route was just to prove that it is indeed possible to do a full clear with sejuani, so it is not really her weakness. And by the way, most junglers indeed do only half of the jungle, even if they have good clears, for example i always go back with my xin after clearing only 1 half of the jungle, so i would be able to gank with an item ready.

She is not as weak as someone would portray her, and her damage while building full tank is really, hard do deal with because she also has mobility in a form of a dash and lots and lots of cc.

They need to be very careful.  They have nerfed cinder hulk twice now and Sejuani once (rather significantly).  She wasn't even on anyone's radar till the adition of cinderhulk (I played her all the time and she was mostly balanced before the item changes).   I have to agree if they are going to layer nerfs like this they need to go more slowly so she isn't nerfed back onto the shelf where no one played her.

My fear is that she has a kit similar to Irelia in that Sejuani is able to do too many things.  She is naturally tanky, she has a wall jump, dash popup, lots of slows, snap damage, team stun, all four skills do local AE damage, and with proper items her damage scales frighteningly well while staying tanky (like a jungle Nasus that no one actually expects and needs money rather than stacks).

Given the above for Sejuani to be "healthy" I fear she is always going to need to be under-tuned due to her kits overwelming number of tools.  With this said I don't want them to change her kit again.
The % max hp is a massive nerf the cut nearly to the half...

Once again... we're going to nerf down a champion because of the environmental changes build up around them.  So when the environment inevitably changes again, she'll fade back into obscurity, her fans will feel bad about the state she's left in, and Riot won't give a shit because she's not being played anymore (apparently her Ulti suddenly became too OP and needed a nerf just because more people are playing her).  Have fun waiting for the random "we realize these champoins aren't played very much" buffs that come around a couple times every year.

The problem with Sejuani in my opinion is she has one of if not the best initiation ultimate in the game as well as a ton of tools. I don't think she can ever have anything more than undertuned damage numbers so long as she holds onto all her cc/teamfight presence.
While I agree with you, I have to point out that before the introduction of Cinderhulk barley anyone had any interest in Sejuani, although her CC abilities were the same.

Well the thing with Cinderhulk is that it basically makes tanks' mid/late games come a bit faster. With both that and a bunch of tanks being in meta, Sejauni's having less of a hard time getting to her extremely strong late game. I think that's part of the reason why Sejuani's showing up. For such a CC heavy tank, she does a ton of damage and, currently, her mid-late game is currently almost guaranteed.

Yes, I know why she is strong right now. ( I main her since over a year now...)

You were the person who argued, that Sejuani is strong with just the CC. And she is (in my opinion), but looking back a lot of people seem to think, that CC alone is not enough. So it would be nice to keep her at a point where she isn't banned all the time, but also gets a little more attention than in s4.
She needs to be nerfed, but carefully. But as I already wrote somewhere else in this thread: I could imagine, that they reduced her numbers so much this time, since they also want to introduce the new abyssal scepter, which should have a very good synergy with Sejuanis damage.

I'm not trying to argue what makes her strong or what to do with her, I'm just acknowledging that she is strong and can either keep the CC or the damage. I was just pointing out that Cinderhulk alone wasn't what made her relevant again. I fully agree with you on every point though.

She is the highest winrate champion _in the entire game._  You think 2% less on those abilities at max rank will fix her?

And please don't suggest that winrate means nothing.  It means something when viewed in conjunction with pickrate.  If she was extremely uncommon but successful, like Malzahar, it would suggest only her mains played her.  But her massive popularity + massive succes suggests that not only is she heavily overtuned, but so easy to succeed with that the majority of people who pick her still win, whether they know her kit or not.
You mean 2% on two different abilities (so 4% dmg nerf) on basically her ONLY dmg ability? Yeah, this is a major nerf that will see her back in the 4-7% pick rate.

A major nerf is justified.  I'm not saying it isn't significant.  I'm saying it just might be enough to make her stop being the most successful champion in the entire game uninterrupted for months on end.
Besides, she retains her CC and her tankiness.  If her current strength is so heavily tied to her damage, there's clearly a problem.

And no, it doesn't impact clear times too significantly, because it remains the same at rank 1 and only tapers off as your rank increases, around the time you're completing cinderhulk and clearing becomes incredibly easy anyway.
